message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CV. 

The paper deals with machine translation, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a novel method that involves learning from human interactions, which suggests the involvement of artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, making cs.AI the second likely sub-category. The proposed method involves memorizing revision actions based on context, which suggests the use of machine learning (ML) techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) the third likely sub-category. The paper also involves improving translation results, which suggests the involvement of information retrieval (IR) techniques, making cs.IR the fourth likely sub-category. Finally, the paper involves experiments with translation models, which suggests the involvement of computer vision (CV) techniques, making cs.CV the fifth likely sub-category.
